title: Protecting our planet everyday.

explainer.monthly: Your monthly donation will help Greenpeace research solutions and to work globally to protect our planet. Thank you!
explainer.onetime: Your donation will immediately help Greenpeace's work to protect our planet. Thank you!

lead: Greenpeace researches and documents environmental problems. Please help us to continue caring for our natural world.

payload.title: Your donation will help protect the planet!
payload.subTitle: Greenpeace is trusted by millions of people around the world to care for the environment and help protect our planet for future generations. Here's what your donation will do:

payload.title: Greenpeace goes where others can't.
payload.subTitle: Our independent research teams travel to some of the most remote parts of the globe. From the Amazon rainforests to the Arctic wilderness you can trust that Greenpeace will report back on environmental problems and work with local communities and governments to find a solution.

payload.title: Your donation will have an impact.
payload.subTitle: Greenpeace works across 6 global issues:

items.headline: CLIMATE
items.description: To save the climate and build a safer, greener fairer world together.

items.headline: OCEANS
items.description: To protect the source of all life and our best defences against climate change.

items.headline: ARCTIC
items.description: To protect the Arctic from destructive oil drilling and commercial fishing.

items.headline: FORESTS
items.description: To take action to stop deforestation, expose illegal logging activities, and protect indigenous rights.

items.headline: PLASTICS
items.description: To rid the world of plastics and toxics for a healthier world.

items.headline: HEALTH
items.description: To ensure healthy food for all, and protect the soil, water and the climate.

payload.title: Your donation will ensure a better future
payload.subTitle: Since 1971, Greenpeace has worked to bring about change. Here are just some of our achievements.

items.headline: Health
items.description: 1971: Greenpeace's first action took place to stop a US nuclear weapons test, raising awareness of nuclear safety.

items.headline: Oceans
items.description: 1991: The 39 Antarctic Treaty signatories agreed to a 50-year minimum prohibition of all mineral exploitation.

items.headline: Climate
items.description: 1997: Greenpeace developed Greenfreeze, a completely fluorocarbon-free household refrigerator.

items.headline: Climate
items.description: 1997: Greenpeace developed Greenfreeze, a completely fluorocarbon-free household refrigerator.

items.headline: Arctic
items.description: 2015: We gathered over 8 million people worldwide to say NO to oil drilling in the Arctic, Shell later abandoned its operations there.

items.headline: Oceans
items.description: 2017: 80 global clothing brands and suppliers included Zara, H&M and Uniqlo committed to detoxing their clothing production.

items.headline: Climate
items.description: 2018: Samsung electronics commits to 100% renewable energy in the US, Eurpoe and China by 2020.

items.headline: Health
items.description: 2018: Following actions by Greenpeace in Hong Kong, the government halted plans to develop country parks.
